item.description:
While its not the crack of dawn its still early for a Saturday... lets give the weekend a proper start with an energizing hike in the Fells!

What's the plan?

We're going to hike the Rock Circuit Trail, covering roughly 4.25 miles of rocky trail. While the terrain is not nearly as challenging as the Whites, there are a few steep ascents to rocky outcrops that provide nice views of the surrounding area and we'll get a bit of elevation and do some climbing. We also plan to hike at a relatively fast pace - 3+mph - and hope to finish in about 1 hour 30 min. You don't need to be an experienced hiker to join, but you should have some reasonable level of aerobic fitness.  So you know what to expect - we're out to get exercise, not take a leisurely, relaxed stroll in the woods. 

Where will we meet?

We're meeting  at Flynn Rink on Elm St/Woodland Rd - just past the round-about.  Please be on time - many folks have plans for the rest of the day and if we start late, we'll finish late and mess up our schedules. I'll leave the lot promptly at 7:30AM. 

What should I bring?

Water (24 oz - 1 Liter), good hiking shoes/trail runners, bug spray

More Info:

Rain will cancel - I'll send out an email (with my cell phone number) to confirmed participants the day before the hike to confirm details.

You can find out more information about the Fells here:  http://www.fells.org/visit/

And you can print out free maps here: http://www.fellsbiker.com/maps
item.name: Saturday Morning Hike at the Middlesex Fells
